clinical_study.brief_title: The PATH Study to Promote Physical Activity After Knee Replacement
clinical_study.official_title: Promoting Physical Activity Via Physical Therapist Following Knee Replacement- The PATH Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to examine the feasibility and preliminary efficacy of a physical therapist led physical activity intervention for knee replacement patients within an outpatient physical therapy facility.

detailed_description.textblock: Physical activity does not typically increase after knee replacement; thus, the purpose of this study is to examine if physical activity levels will be higher among knee replacement patients who receive a physical therapist led physical activity intervention during standard physical therapy sessions. Physical activity levels will be assessed at the start of outpatient therapy and at 12 weeks after surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants enrolled vs. approached
primary_outcome.description: Feasibility will be determined based on the number of participants enrolled vs. the number approached

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants who complete the 12 week assessment
primary_outcome.description: Acceptability will be determined by the percentage of participants completing the 12 week assessment.

secondary_outcome.description: Total number of minutes of objectively-measured moderate-vigorous intensity physical activity/week

arm_group.description: PATH participants will receive Standard Outpatient Physical Therapy. In addition, physical therapist discuss physical activity & assist with goal setting during therapy sessions.

PATH-12 participants will receive Standard Outpatient Physical Therapy. In addition, PATH-12 participants will receive a Physical activity session (1-hour) focusing on physical activity and goal setting at 12 weeks after surgery.

intervention.description: Participants will receive standard outpatient physical therapy that is typical following knee replacement

intervention.intervention_name: Physical therapist discuss aerobic physical activity
intervention.description: Physical therapists will provide recommendations to increase aerobic physical activity and set goals during standard physical therapy sessions after knee replacement.
Participants will receive a one hour coaching session on aerobic physical activity and goal setting after knee replacement.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Be 40-79 years of age
- Have had a knee replacement in the last 2 months
- Be willing to wear and accelerometer for 7 days during assessments
- Be English speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have any contraindications to activity
- Have a mobility limiting comorbidity
- Have a scheduled surgery within the next 6 months

patient_data.ipd_description: Given the preliminary nature of the study and small sample size, we do not plan to share data with others, unless requested to do so.
